channel.title: Food - Digg
channel.description: Food on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: IKEA Released Its Iconic Swedish Meatball Recipe. Here's How To Make Them
item.description: IKEA decided to release its Swedish meatball recipe for home cooks to make during coronavirus quarantine. Here are the ingredients and directions.

item.title: Everyone Is Baking — And Entrepreneurs Are Rising Up To Meet The Demand
item.description: A look behind the numbers driving the latest quarantine craze and the small businesses that are filling a gap in the market.

item.title: We Aren't Sure Whether This Potato Chip Omelette Hack Is The Worst Idea Ever Or Something Fun To Try
item.description: The food influencers at Chefclub came up with this, er, unconventional way to cook a Crispy Potato Chip Omelette, which is being hailed online as either brilliant or a crime against humanity.

item.title: Coronavirus Broke The Global Food Supply Chain. It May Never Recover
item.description: Turns out once you turn off the milk, it's pretty difficult to turn it back on. And small changes will likely have profound global consequences

item.title: My Body Is Not AÂ Temple
item.description: All the good habits and self-optimization in the world don't give you real control over your body. Back away from the bread starter.

item.title: 10 Pioneer-Era Apple Types Thought Extinct Found In US West
item.description: A team of retirees that scours the remote ravines and windswept plains of the Pacific Northwest has rediscovered 10 apple varieties — the largest number ever unearthed in a season.
item.kicker: APPLES TO APPLES, DUST TO DUST

item.title: Unholy Anorexia
item.description: Medieval mystics starved the body to feed the soul. Understanding this perfectionist mindset could help treat anorexia today.

item.title: Woman Shocked To Find A Groundhog Scarfing Down A Pizza Outside Her Door
item.description: Kristin Chalela Bagnell had the shock of a lifetime when she, and her two dogs, noticed a large rodent munching on a pizza(!), outside her sliding glass door.

item.title: The Green Sludge That Could Transform Our Diets
item.description: Microalgae is rich in protein, amino acids, fatty acids and vitamins. Should we all be eating it?

item.title: Yes, #Quarantinebaking Has Caused A Temporary Flour Shortage. But Not For The Reasons You'd Think
item.description: The pandemic-driven demand spike is more hiccup than disruption. But for regional grain economies, it's a grueling, make-or-break test.

item.title: This Dog Trying Steak For The First Time Will Make You Feel All Warm and Tingly Inside
item.description: Milk the Samoyed tries meat for the first time and it's an oddly satisfying ASMR experience.

item.title: How I Learned To Stop Worrying And Love My Freezer
item.description: There's a technique — even a flair — to freezing food successfully

item.title: The Food Expiration Dates You Should Actually Follow
item.description: The first thing you should know? The dates, as we know them, have nothing to do with safety.

item.title: An Animated Chart Of The Biggest Fast Food Franchises In The World In The Past 50 Years
item.description: In the world of fast food chains, which franchise reigns supreme when it comes to the number of stores worldwide?

item.title: I Run A Butcher Shop In Small-Town Pennsylvania. COVID-19 Has Transformed My Business — Possibly Forever
item.description: We used to be a place where our community gathered. Our approach has changed in ways we never could have imagined.

item.title: The Problem With Shrimp
item.description: Shrimp farming releases huge quantities of greenhouse gases, in addition to supporting abusive labor practices.

item.title: How Panic Buying Has Put An Incredible Strain On Food Banks Even As The Need For Them Explodes
item.description: Panic shopping and hoarding have led to supply shortages. Volunteers frightened of the virus have stopped showing up. And a newly jobless population has sent demand soaring.

item.title: Brad, From The Bon AppÃ©tit Test Kitchen, Makes Garlic Ginger Paste At Home
item.description: Even during the quarantine, the hard working test kitchen chef's from Bon AppÃ©tit continue to share their knowledge. This week, Brad Leone returns with home made garlic ginger paste on "It's Alive."
item.kicker: 'I DON'T EVEN HAVE TO MOVE, JUST PIVOT'

item.title: CSA And Local Produce Demands Are Skyrocketing, But Farmers Can't Keep Up
item.description: Farmers can't keep up with surging demand for local produce, but they're still struggling to replace lost revenue.

item.title: It's Time To Delete Your Delivery Apps
item.description: For weeks, as restaurants begged delivery platforms to reduce their commissions, the apps refused, further profiting from the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: DoubleTree Hotel's Secret Chocolate Chip Recipe Has Just Been Revealed
item.description: The celebrity of desserts—The DoubleTree by Hilton's chocolate chip cookie—is now available for at-home bakers to make.

item.title: Professional Cooks Demonstrate 13 Different Ways To Make Interesting Pasta With What's In Your Pantry
item.description: It's time to jazz up your pasta offerings with advice from these veteran Bon AppÃ©tit chefs.

item.title: A Beginner's Guide To Gordon Ramsay's Sprawling, Tyrannical TV Empire
item.description: The British chef's charming indignation can keep you occupied for at least a couple weeks of quarantine.
item.kicker: BOW DOWN TO THE MASTER CHEF

item.title: I Tried The Viral (And Vintage) Peanut Butter Bread Reddit Is Obsessed With Right Now
item.description: You don't need yeast, it's ready in an hour and it's basically impossible to mess up.

item.title: Food Is No Longer Your Fallback Job. It Never Should Have Been In The First Place
item.description: There is no such thing as a "bad" job, just bad working conditions — and the coronavirus crisis should be our call to action to fix that.

item.title: The Invasion Of Antarctica Begins With Mussels
item.description: The bivalves — likely transported from Patagonia via ship — are the first nonnative marine species to settle on the White Continent.

item.title: The Sweet Science Of Baking While Sheltering In Place
item.description: Retreating to our kitchens offers a sense of calm and clarity in these uncertain times.

item.title: Pastry Chef Attempts To Make Cadbury Creme Eggs Completely From Scratch
item.description: Claire Saffitz takes a whack at the iconic Easter candy in the Bon AppÃ©tit test kitchen.

item.title: Grow Your Own Food Using Plant Cuttings With This Ingenious Garden Hack
item.description: Here's five foods you can grow yourself using plant cuttings.

item.title: Guy Shows Off Next Level Cutting Skills In Hilarious Video About How To Become A Better Cook
item.description: Turns out the key to cutting vegetables quickly does not lie with the knife at all.

item.title: No For Real, What Is Yeast Exactly
item.description: And can I use the decade-old yeast packet I found in the back of my pantry?

item.title: How The Maxwell House Haggadah Found A Permanent Place At The Seder Table
item.description: Since the 1920s, the coffee brand has distributed more than 60 million copies of its iconic Haggadah for American Passover Seders
item.kicker: 'THIS IS A PIECE OF JEWISH AMERICANA'

item.title: The Saga Of Punkin' Donuts
item.description: How a doughnut-shop parking lot became a confluence of Chicago youth subcultures — and what killed it off.

item.title: How To Bring In Food From The Outside World While Exposing Yourself The Least To The Coronavirus
item.description: There's no evidence that coronavirus can be transmitted by food yet but food safety experts give you the best advice for staying safe.

item.title: How School Districts Are Able To Feed More People Than Food Banks
item.description: Food banks are overwhelmed due to coronavirus. School cafeterias across the country are closed, but have become grab-and-go centers for people in need.

item.title: Outdoor Survivalist Reveals A MacGyver-Like Technique To Catching A Fish With A Mouse Trap
item.description: Canadian outdoor recreationalist Greg Ovens demonstrates a curious method for hooking trout.
item.kicker: MORE THAN ONE WAY TO CATCH A FISH

item.title: When The Government Banned PBR, Pabst Made Cheese Instead
item.description: Selling dairy products helped the brewery survive Prohibition.

item.title: YouTuber Goes Inside An Average Wet Market In China And It's Stunningly Mundane
item.description: Cable news has made China's wet markets seem like they're all crawling with exotic animals but in reality, they're a lot like American farmer's markets.

item.title: Self-Isolation Is Triggering My Eating Disorder, And This Is How I'm Coping
item.description: How one woman's recovery is being affected by the pandemic.

item.title: 'It Was Gone Overnight': One Restaurant's Struggle To Weather The Pandemic
item.description: Eric Wang first noticed something was wrong on March 9.

item.title: Alton Brown Gives His Tips On How To Make The Best Onion Dip At Home
item.description: Now is the time to get down and dirty with some onions and mayo.

item.title: I Was Food Insecure For Years. Affluent People Finally Understand A Little Of What It's Like
item.description: The shared experience of grocery shortages is very different from the quiet struggle of people who are used to food insecurity.

item.title: Gordon Ramsay Has The Perfect Ten-Minute Lamb Chop Dinner Recipe
item.description: Is this a new show called "Cooking With The Ramsey's?"
item.kicker: 'PUT IT ON THE GAS AND TURN IT ON'

item.title: If You Literally Never Cook, Start Here
item.description: How to get started on your cooking journey, from frying eggs and saucing pasta to roasting chickens and making soup.

item.title: Down The Drain: Wisconsin Dairy Farmers Told To Dump Milk Because Of An Oversupply In The Market
item.description: A West Bend farm says it was told to start dumping tens of thousands of gallons of milk per day because of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Alton Brown Demonstrates How To Enhance Your Rice With This Simple Technique
item.description: The food show presenter presents his "fast and foolproof method for cooking rice in a hurry."

item.title: I Lived Off Homemade Soylent For A Week During A Global Crisis
item.description: While some out here are leaning hard into home cooking, it might actually be a good time to perfect self-sustenance.

item.title: An Amateur, Home Cook And Professional Chef Each Make Their Own Version Of Fried Rice
item.description: Fried rice gets a unique spin from chefs with different levels of expertise.

item.title: Stop Torturing Yourself With Quarantine Diets
item.description: Memes and jokes about gaining weight during the coronavirus pandemic are everywhere and they're body-shaming at its most insidious.

item.title: The Coronavirus Delivery Pivot Is Already Coming To An End
item.description: As dining rooms around the country shuttered in response to the pandemic, restaurants turned to delivery and takeout — but now, some chefs are saying it's not worth it.
